JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Julia Laffranque;Khanlar Hajiyev;Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , PERSON , PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr FAC , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE . They were represented before the ORG by lawyers of ORG , based in GPE and GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by Mr PERSON GPE , Representative of GPE at ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . The applicants ( a mother , daughter and CARDINAL sons ) are former residents of GPE . Prior to DATE , the family lived in a flat and a house in ORG . They submitted that the first applicant had owned a flat at DATE FAC . The second applicant ( the first applicant ’s daughter ) had been the registered owner of a house situated at CARDINAL ORG . In DATE the first applicant had purchased CARDINAL further houses adjacent to her daughter ’s house ( CARDINAL ORG FAC and FAC ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of PERSON confirmed that the second applicant owned a share of the property situated at CARDINAL ORG . On DATE the court confirmed that the CARDINAL applicants ( and CARDINAL other individuals ) had lived at the said property prior to DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE ORG ( “ ORG ” ) in GPE issued certificates of title to the first and second applicants relating to CARDINAL land plots of the above - mentioned addresses .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the ORG informed the first applicant by letter that its archives had been destroyed . The register maintained by the ORG contained CARDINAL relevant entries showing that the first applicant owned the properties at FAC , QUANTITY / FAC and DATE FAC . The second applicant owned the house at CARDINAL ORG . No corresponding certificates of title were submitted to the ORG by the applicants .
CARDINAL . DATE and in DATE ORG carried out counterterrorist operations in GPE . Fearing hostilities , the applicants moved to GPE on an unspecified date .

CARDINAL . The applicants submitted that during the CARDINAL campaigns , missile strikes by the NORP air force in DATE and DATE had resulted in the destruction of their properties and all their possessions . They submitted a complaint about both incidents to the prosecutor ’s office in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE a prosecutor of military unit no . CARDINAL refused the ORG request to open a criminal investigation . The applicants were given the option to appeal , commence a civil claim for damages or to seek compensation under Government Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE .

CARDINAL . It appears that the applicants made a further application to the prosecutor ’s office for a criminal investigation to be opened into the complaint relating to the DATE attack ; however , this was dismissed on DATE . The applicants were again given the option to appeal or to commence a civil claim for damages .
CARDINAL . The applicants sued the ORG , ORG and ORG , with a view to obtaining compensation for the destruction of their property and possessions as a result of the events of DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE delivered its judgment . It held that under LAW , the ORG was only liable for damage caused by the unlawful conduct of its agents . ORG noted that the military operation in GPE had been authorised by Presidential Decree no . PERSON dated DATE and Government decree no . CARDINAL of DATE . Both decrees had been considered compatible with the LAW by ORG on DATE . The court thus found that no unlawful conduct by a ORG body had taken place which could justify payment of compensation . The court further dismissed the ORG claim that the damage had been caused by a particularly hazardous ORG - owned object , since the applicants had not submitted any conclusive evidence to substantiate their allegations about the manner in which their property had been destroyed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the first - instance court ’s judgment .
